description:
If the FLAGS.allow_resize_to_same_host flag is set to True and a migrate call is sent to nova-api, the scheduler is allowed to select the current host of the instance as the destination. This basically results in doing nothing, migrating from the source to the destination host.

The problem is with the logic in compute/api.py resize method.

 if not FLAGS.allow_resize_to_same_host:
            filter_properties['ignore_hosts'].append(instance['host'])

should be

 if (not FLAGS.allow_resize_to_same_host) or (not resize):
            filter_properties['ignore_hosts'].append(instance['host'])

So that when doing just a migrate the current instance host is added to the ignore list.
title: nova migrate with FLAGS.allow_resize_to_same_host=True can select same host

comments.content:
I'm marking this as not fix because the allow_resize_to_same host is a flag primarily for testing single node installs. The expectation is that it will be off in most situations. The disadvantage of the change that you are requesting is that we can no longer test migrate on a single host.

Please comment if you strongly disagree with this decision.

If we do decide to change it the logic should be

if not FLAGS.allow_resize_to_same host or not flavor_id:
comments.author: https://api.launchpad.net/1.0/~vishvananda

comments.content:
The allow_resize_to_same_host makes sense in the one-host debugging case, but with some driver code I am working on, we were trying to make a resize to same host possible and do a "live" resize of the VM if we can still fit it. Obviously a migrate should still be a migrate to another host.

After reading your comment, I'm convinced that trying to do this 'live' resize of changing the VCPU and memory count of a VM on the same host through the current resize API call is probably not what I want to do.

Would this be something that we would want to try to expand into the current resize API or would this be better off as a blueprint for adding a whole new "live" resize call path from the API down to the driver?
